column4: my usb transfers are very slow, how can i make them faster? it seems like usb1 instead of usb2
cornet just to transfer to an usb pen from my computer and backto other computer
could it be the USB key ?
some of them are frightfully slow
cornet dont thinks so, i have many usb and it happens with all of them, i have 4 computers too and it happens with all of them too
cornet yes, it starts fast but it decreases the speed
have you done some tests with dd or bonnie to see if  exactly what the rate of transfer is ?

cornet i was reading this http://www.linuxquestions.org/questions/linux-hardware-18/ext3-usb-hd-slow-transfer-rates-ubuntumanual-mount-646506/ i dont know if its outdated, and i couldnt find where to change tofix it,thesolution is in post #7
cornet no i havent, i have just been using nautilus
ok you need to add those options to the kernel boot line
cornet i dont know how to do it, can you tell me please how?
maybe you dont have a bottom bar to hold them
Take a look at https://help.ubuntu.com/community/BootOptions about 1/2 way down the page, you want the section entitled "Change Boot Options Temporarily For An Existing Installation"
a bit further down it'll also tell you how to change them perminantly
cornet great, let me read it :Dthanks a lot
np - hope you get it fixed :)
